summary: This document is an email chain from August 2020 among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff discussing Touhy requests (requests for government information) related to Jeffrey Epstein. The emails focus on handling document requests from an Epstein victim (identified as Maria Lacerda) and her counsel (Roberta Kaplan) for use in civil litigation, debating disclosure obligations, Giglio implications, and coordination with other districts.

persons.name: John McEnany
persons.context: A prosecutor in the SDNY U.S. Attorney's Office involved in discussions about responding to Touhy requests from Epstein victims, raising concerns about potential Giglio disclosures.

persons.name: Steven Kochevar
persons.context: The point person for handling Touhy requests from civil plaintiffs/victims in Epstein lawsuits, drafting response letters and coordinating document production.

persons.name: David Jones
persons.context: CC'd on email discussions regarding the Touhy request process and strategy.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: A prosecutor involved in the case, questioning the Giglio theory and coordinating with Steven Kochevar on victim requests.

persons.name: Maria Lacerda
persons.context: Identified as 'Jane Doe' in the emails, she is an Epstein victim and plaintiff in a civil suit who submitted a Touhy request for documents.

persons.name: Roberta Kaplan
persons.context: Attorney (Robbie Kaplan) at Kaplan Hecker & Fink representing the victim/plaintiff in civil litigation, to whom initial Touhy process letters were sent.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the criminal investigation; the document requests relate to information about him.

persons.name: Sarah
persons.context: Referred to as a 'wiser Touhy head' in the Civil Division to be consulted on procedural questions.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: Mentioned as having signed off on a Touhy response letter and document production.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Mentioned as having signed off on a Touhy response letter and document production.

persons.name: Jeffrey
persons.context: Referred to by John McEnany as someone he spoke to about continuing to use Steven Kochevar as the point of contact for Touhy requests.

connections.description: Colleagues in the SDNY U.S. Attorney's Office coordinating on legal strategy for responding to Touhy requests related to the Epstein case.
Colleagues working together on the Epstein case, with Alex providing input on victim communications and Giglio concerns.
Attorney Kaplan represents victim Maria Lacerda in civil litigation against Epstein's estate, as evidenced by the Touhy request submissions.
Kochevar, as the government's point of contact, corresponds with Kaplan regarding the formal Touhy request process for her client.
McEnany discusses the handling of document requests from victim Maria Lacerda and potential Giglio implications regarding her status.

events.title: Email Debate on Touhy Request as Giglio
events.description: John McEnany emails colleagues stating that Touhy communications with victim 'VB' are probably disclosable as Giglio information, sparking a debate with Alex about whether producing documents constitutes a benefit.

events.title: Maxwell Team Approval of Touhy Response
events.description: Steven Kochevar sends an updated response letter to a victim's Touhy request, noting that 'The Maxwell team is okay with this version of the letter,' indicating coordination with Ghislaine Maxwell's defense.

events.title: Identification of Jane Doe as Maria Lacerda
events.description: John McEnany confirms in an email that 'Jane Doe' from the Touhy request is Maria Lacerda, and approves the production of a grand jury subpoena previously disclosed to her.

events.title: Establishment of Touhy Request Process
events.description: Email discussion establishes Steven Kochevar as the point person for Epstein-related Touhy requests from civil plaintiffs/victims, with Alex to notify plaintiff's counsel Roberta Kaplan.

keyFacts: Prosecutors debated whether complying with a victim's Touhy request for documents could be construed as a 'benefit' to her, potentially triggering Giglio disclosure obligations.
The 'Maxwell team' (Ghislaine Maxwell's defense) was consulted and approved a version of the government's response letter to a victim's Touhy request.
A victim making a Touhy request is identified as Maria Lacerda, who is a plaintiff in civil litigation against Epstein's estate.

The U.S. Attorney's Office for SDNY possessed FBI investigative files from the SDFL Epstein investigation but deliberately avoided obtaining files from the SDFL U.S. Attorney's Office due to conflict and discovery concerns.
Prosecutors considered directing requesters to the Northern District of Georgia for materials from the SDFL investigation, as NDGA had 'stepped into the shoes' of SDFL for Epstein purposes.
